website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy lap desk with plenty of on-board storage for paper, pens, and other stationery supplies.
pros: Lightweight yet sturdy enough for textbooks and laptops
Desk surface flips up to reveal a generous storage tray
Features folding legs for improved portability and fuss-free storage

website_summaries.verdict: Specifically constructed for those wanting ample storage and organization in their lap desk.
pros: Large storage space located under the desk top that includes dividers for smaller accessories
Legs fold in easily when you want to save room
Works great for a variety of activities
Customers love using it for road trips
cons: Some buyers claimed the legs had trouble staying upright
Plastic material makes for a cheaper-looking product

customer_reviews.title: Good for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this table for doing crossword puzzles and for diamond embroidery crafts. It's excellent for storing my craft supplies and pens. I rarely use the legs and just place the folded desk on my lap however the leg room measures 16" which is plenty even for a larger person like myself. It's very easy to store when not in use. .
customer_reviews.author: Christina Shuey

customer_reviews.title: Great for car
customer_reviews.text: Needed something sturdy for a child to do homework in the car with. It’s great. Sturdy. Plenty of working space and storage space. Fairly priced. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Massel

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get, and a good quality item.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my college age girls to use for studying at home. I love the storage space underneath the top, I added some surprise school supplies for them when I gave it to them. This lap desk is sturdy and folds up nicely for storage. I am seriously giving thought to purchasing a 3rd on for my youngest daughter to do her homework on as well.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great little desk for kids and as a portable little one for adults!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love using this for their homework, especially if they don't feel like working at an actual desk or table, and I especially enjoy the storage space inside--if I don't have time to finish dealing with some papers, I love being able to open the lid, throw everything in so that it wouldn't make the area seem untidy, and I'll pull it out whenever I'm ready to get to it again.
customer_reviews.author: Zoriana Selepina

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.  Easy transport
customer_reviews.text: This is what I needed. A perfect little table for studying or working on paperwork from you couch, chair, bed... The legs snap down easily and stay up until snapped back down. Folds flat so I was able to take it in my luggage on a recent trip. The storage area is nice to have when moving from place to place.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Use for my clients...
customer_reviews.text: So far it's working great! I had to get a lap desk for my office when my company moved to our own building and took some of our furniture out. I thought it might be too flimsy, but it's pretty sturdy and super easy for my littlest clients to open and close up.
customer_reviews.author: La guera 24

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this tray
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this tray. Although the size is what we needed for our son, the construction is terrible. The pins that hold the lid in place continuously fall out, the legs do not stay locked in place, and they plastic is not sturdy. Not worth the money. Edited to add: after writing this review the company reached out to me and offered an exchange or refund in exchange for a better review. My review still stands and I will not be bought off in order to leave false reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Budgirl820

customer_reviews.title: Great for working in small projects!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for working on small projects while sitting on the couch. I work from home and on the road. This also works well in the car if I need to do paperwork while I am out and about working.
customer_reviews.author: Creativetype

customer_reviews.title: Laptop table and storage very well made.
customer_reviews.text: I love the dividers inside. Plenty of room to hold a variety of things. Low priced and so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Brian LS

customer_reviews.title: Grandsons lego desk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandsons Birthday.I glued lego mats to top and inside. He hasn't received it yet but I think it will be a great take along desk.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: We've just used them today and already my kids and I love them. It's the end of the school year ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received these yesterday. I bought them because I homeschool and I'm tired of the mess all over the kitchen table. We've just used them today and already my kids and I love them. It's the end of the school year but we can tell that they are going to be great for next year. They are going to be handy for our summer vacation road trip as well. I love the storage inside and that they fold up and all three fit in one cubby on the shelf. Just perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: kevin sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Already Broke Less than 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for less than a day and already one of the pins for the hinges has fallen out and it's broken. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: broke within 3 days
customer_reviews.text: this came with scratch marks and ...like oily fingerprints, on the top and one of the legs, at first, wouldn't stay open, i'd keep on having to adjust it throughout the day. but i thought "this is good enough for me." was going to keep it. within 3 days, one of the hinges attaching the leg to the desk completely broke, making this unusable. i returned it and will not get another one. at least it broke within the return window. ps i am a woman who is not hard on my stuff. i didn't store a computer or anything heavy in it. it's just not well made.
customer_reviews.author: sunnydaysahead

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for travel. So practical without taking up too much space. The folding legs can hold a decent laptop weight, and are ideal for in the car, on the couch and in bed. The storage space is helpful with keeping pencil, earphones and my surface tablet
customer_reviews.author: Conservative Queen

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed in this product. Loved the idea. However, I’m not a big person,but had to keep my legs in a straight single line to use, as I have hip and back problems, this was not ideal for me. Also, the legs kept collapsing, so defeats the purpose of it in general. It would be an improvement if there was an extended side so you could keep things inside, but also have like a cup holder on the extension tray so you don’t have to clear everything off to open up the top.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Black

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap, not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The item looks nice, but ultimately it is cheap. It is very flexy plastic, not hard sturdy plastic. The legs have to be clicked all the way out, and even then they keep folding back in randomly. I’m constantly having to push them back out. The lid doesnt even click open like in the picture. It just flops all the way back. The metal that holds the top and bottom together is missing. Overall disappointed. This could have been avoided by simply using a sturdier material.
customer_reviews.author: Semaj

customer_reviews.title: Won't work for most adults.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'5 and 138 lbs. My legs are somehow too big and this ends up on my lap not resting on the legs of the desk. It is hard to balance, the legs want to keep folding up, and there isn't much room. The legs do not reach the chair under me, the couch, the recliner, the benches I sit on, or the bed. This solely relies on the lap. I do like that it has the storage compartment in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick and Ashly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for after my nephew's surgery
customer_reviews.text: My 4 yr old nephew had surgery on his right hand and right foot. Both are casted for six weeks. This was the perfect gift. It is sturdy and he is able to eat his meals on the tray while having his treasures tucked inside. Also GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.author: J. Reina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product & Service with status "Delivered" 2 days earlier than actual delivery (system?)
customer_reviews.text: Initial order was just in time as promised. Thank YOU for Great Service! Unfortunately defect product. However seller was professional and understanding to send a replacement which finally got in but late delivery by the driver. This to correct my previous review. I FINALLY received the REPLACEMENT. It was delivered Saturday -NOT Thursday as AMAZON Order status indicated. My friend brought me the package last night as some truck delivered the item in replacement to the bad one. Although it was unfortunate and frustrating to see the order status wrongly update, I would advise anyone to get this great item. Seller is a professional, experience and customer-minded! Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia K.

customer_reviews.title: Not enough leg room!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table so I can use my laptop while I am sitting on the couch. I’m petite and my legs aren’t that huge and I hardly had any space from the top of my thighs to the table area. The compartment dips under the table and takes away leg space. I don’t really need the compartment space but I thought it was a cool extra. If you have large thighs you will have trouble with the product. It would have been ideal if it was raised about 5”. I am debating if I should keep for my 3 year old or return. It is not suitable for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More pleased than I expected
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased two of these unsure how’d they work for my children who would be doing online schooling this year. They just came and I instantly ordered two more for my other two children. I was concerned about the leg room.. I was very surprised to see that it was big enough for everyone in my home one of which weighs 210. Not much storage space but def more than the picture captures. This works perfect for everyone to have a desk (that’s portable when needing quiet for zoom meetings) I’d recommend this for anyone trying to save space while turning their home into a “school setting”!
customer_reviews.author: Taja

customer_reviews.title: Solid, hard plastic tray.
customer_reviews.text: Good for a meal on your lap or writing. The picture shows the lid opened straight up but it really doesn't do that, it flops all the way open. I had thought it would stay up on its own, to possibly lean a piece of paper against but when you open the lid it opens all the way. The storage compartment isn't very deep, but deep enough to hold a few papers or a small book. Overall its a nice little lap desk but don't be fooled by the photo of the lid staying up by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Rose S

customer_reviews.title: ... my son for his Laptop the plastic is not sturdy enough and keeps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his Laptop the plastic is not sturdy enough and keeps falling
customer_reviews.author: nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and small
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work better than a standard lap desk with a pillow underneath. The flat surface of the top is a plus over a lot of other tables of this type. Unfortunately it is so flimsy one leg broke off (irreparably) the first week and and I'm having to use a pillow under it anyway. Plus, the size (width/height) under it is more child-sized than adult sized.
customer_reviews.author: TRC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trays
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these to take on our family vacation so the kids had a place to eat, color and do activities during out long car ride. 2 of them held up perfectly throughout the whole trip and the kids have them in their room to use, but the third one fell apart right away. The metal rods that held the top onto the bottom fell out and even when put back in, they continued to fall out. It made the product unusable for the trip. For the most part, I really am pleased with these. They worked for what I bought them for. We just happened to have been shipped one bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bushong

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are deceiving
customer_reviews.text: It does fit the laptop on the top of the desk. However the inside in the pictures shows A LOT more room than there actually is. the area where they have pictured paper, turn that paper to the side and that is how big that area is. its about the size of a notebook. It does fit a notebook and a pencil/pen holder in it and still has a bit of space before lid hits. overall i wish it would fit my childs chromebook for school as we are doing distance learning and I can't fit everything in. size was very deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Karl K. Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Broken desk, broken heart...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this little lap desk. Love the storage space in the desk top-- it holds journals, pens, and the tv remote! But one leg refused to stay upright, then broke all the way off within two weeks. (By then the top had already been covered with stickers, so a return was out of the question.) Now both legs have come off. I'm using the top, because I like the storage, and need the surface, but it has no legs. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: BossyBookworm

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. I was hoping my son could use it during virtual learning but after unboxing it and snapping the legs into upright position, I didn't feel like it was going to be sturdy enough to trust with my kid. It felt wobbly and like he could potentially dislodge one of the legs and send his laptop tumbling. I would say this would be a good purchase for an older kid or adult, but for my younger kid, I felt like I need something sturdier. The little desk storage space is neat but also seems impractical if you are going to primarily use the lap desk with a lap top.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Marie

customer_reviews.title: The perfect companion
customer_reviews.text: This molded hard-plastic lap desk with legs that fold in and a locking top is exactly what I wanted to hold sketching and painting materials. With the lid down there's a handy carry-handle. There are three compartments under the lid, one large and two smaller ones. Snap the lid shut, pick up the lap desk and off you go. When you open the lid, nothing is scrambled, everything is still in its place. Putting the legs up and down is a bit noisy but they do lock in place. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HapiKamper

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome, but...
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool and recently moved to a smaller home. I figured we'd try lap desks this year, and got these because of the storage capability. We bought 3 of them. I would easily give them 5 stars, except the little metal rods that hold the lid on (so it can hinge) just slide/fall out. All. The. Time. We've had them out of the box for a day and one is already missing. Great idea, but poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: MT Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Lap Desk
customer_reviews.text: Desk is great for working on my laptop while watching TV. I frequently use it with the legs folded up so the extra height helps ease the pain in my aging neck. My wife says it's a little too narrow with the legs down (someday I'll suggest she lose a couple of pounds, but not today). I also gave a Folding Lap Desk to one of my granddaughters who doesn't have space for a full sized desk in her room. She uses it often for homework, art work, and working on her fossil collection.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: perfect to make your tiny office anywhere
customer_reviews.text: My partner is an adjunct professor at a small local university. The other professors have been there longer, so they have taken all the available office space. I got her this product because she needed a way to have a portable work station, and this fit the bill perfectly, while being incredibly in-your-face passive-aggressive about how the university treats adjunct teachers. By just showing up and creating her own little office space in the middle of the hall, she was quickly assigned her own room. LOL suck it admin! For the mfr: Only thing I would suggest is adjustable legroom. Maybe a sliding bracket for the stand hinges?
customer_reviews.author: Brian Russell

customer_reviews.title: Better for kids than adults
customer_reviews.text: The one leg doesn't open all the way and I'm afraid to force it because this is nothing more than cheap plastic. I ended up giving it to my young granddaughter for her "art" stuff - she likes it and it fits her much better than it fits me. I'm not overweight, but this didn't fit over my thighs well thus rendering it useless as a lap desk for me. Granddaughter really likes it though, so there are redeeming qualities. If you want it for a kid, it's good. For you? Not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Burkholder

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, probably not a good size for adults
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids since we are now conducting school from home. I love the storage under the table top, although I wish it were a little bit bigger. The leg room is perfect for my 8 and 10 year olds, but teens and above might have a hard time with it. It works well for papers and small laptops and is sturdy enough not to crack under the pressure the kids leaning against it. Great buy for a temporary situation, but would love to see it in a slightly larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie M

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive lap desk to use now that I’m working from home most days. Well this works for what it is. I like the size and that the top lifts up and I can keep my pens and note pad inside. However every time I move it a little the legs fold. I’ve even pinched myself a couple times trying to stop it from falling. They sound like they lock in to place, but they don’t. That would be my only complaint. If the legs stayed up better, this would be 5 starts all the way.
customer_reviews.author: imjes2cute

customer_reviews.title: Very weak legs
customer_reviews.text: This was super disappointing. I like the drawer aspect but the legs are so weak. The legs can fold in so easy. Any wrong move and your desk will collapse. I really wanted to keep it but I know my son will end up breaking his chrome book during the first of this desk. Overall, I like the idea of the desk but it is not sturdy by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Sonna T.

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good lap desk
customer_reviews.text: This keeps the computer off of my knees. The legs snap into place and stay locked so I don't have to worry about it toppling over or they fold back under when I'm not using my computer. Also good for my iPad when I'm watching movies or playing games. Only suggestion I have is something on the legs. They fold around and the edges seem to be a bit sharp, so I'm thinking a pool noodle should do the trick. I used the noodle, as you can see and just cut like six-inch pieces. Cut a slide out of it and slipped it on and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri C. Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, lightweight, easily carried around and provides a sturdy surface.
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. It’s exactly what I wanted. I have an iPad that I’ve attached a keyboard to, and I needed a more solid foundation for it when I sat in chairs to type. It’s a great size, plus I love the fact that the legs easily fold up or pull out as needed. The other bonus, that I hadn’t even thought to look for, is that I can keep things like my password list, a few pencils and other notes inside it. The compartment is just the right size for papers, erasers, pens, etc. I also use an art program on my iPad hence the art supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Sides collapse
customer_reviews.text: The sides on this thing collapse easily, in fact, constantly. Was gonna return it but too much trouble. Using it for meal tray for someone who is chairbound and it's always collapsing. I also had to put a non skid piece of drawer liner on it so stuff didn't slide off.
customer_reviews.author: HorseladyTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two lap desks as Christmas gifts for my granddaughters. When they opened them on Christmas morning, we discovered a piece was broken off one of the desks, leaving a sharp exposed edge. When I notified the company about the defect, they promptly shipped a replacement unit without even requiring the broken desk to be returned. The new desk arrived in perfect condition within days. Both girls, who are in college and high school, are happy with the desks and use them almost every day for homework. The desks are the perfect size for their laptops, they’re lightweight and portable, and the storage compartments are handy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lee Carlyon

customer_reviews.title: Love the desk, but it fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: Got this desk for my wife for Christmas, and she absolutely loves it. Holds her art supplies and lets her draw, use her laptop, or do whatever right in her lap, or in bed. However, it's 63 days later, and the pins that hold the hinged lid on have fallen out several times, and now one of them has been lost. We appear to be past the return period, because there is no option in Amazon to return or refund it now. If you hold the desk sideways, the pins just slide right out of the hinge. Very bad design component of an otherwise good desk.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Could stand a little more legroom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to do some of his work in bed. I gave it four stars simply because I feel like it could have and stand a little leg Room. My husband has rather small legs so he doesn’t have a problem but I would say someone was thicker legs or thighs could find it difficult or uncomfortable. Other than that it’s a great buy and it works perfectly for what he needs it for.
customer_reviews.author: Rayray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to use on reclining couch 🤪
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent, better than what I was looking for. I wanted something to use my laptop on the couch when I have my feet up on the recliner. It works just perfect for that. I even do Zoom on my computer with it. Plus, I can store paperwork, pens, and stuff inside. It is perfect for my current needs. Sometimes I even put it on a TV tray with it folded up (just so I can have the storage).
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mishler

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop,  iPad or Mobile Desktop for Lap Warriors
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for those of us who use a laptop or iPad while lounging on the sofa. The lap desk can be used with the folding legs down or folded under, as necessary. The flat surface means that it can also be used as a writing desk. It sits higher than the pillows I used previously, causing less neck strain. I like it so much, I purchased a second one to give as a Christmas gift to my granddaughter, who is headed off to college.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves this Mini-Desk
customer_reviews.text: My first grader hates doing homework, but he's having a lot of fun with this desk. He packed it full of pencils, caryons, markers, etc (it holds a lot) and likes having it all there as needed. I like that it folds up easily and fits under my bed. It has good leg room for him and we have not had any issues with it thus far. I'll update if any concerns arise, but as of now it's working great. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jami Lilo

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop desk if the one leg stays open
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice folding laptop desk. My problem is keeping the legs up. One leg will stay up and then the other will close. Will have son to look at it and see why or will have to return it. i will try to contact the seller maybe they can suggest what i can do to keep the legs from constantly closing. if i cannot get help then i would not advise anyone to buy it. i would have returned it but they only give you 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: gdt

customer_reviews.title: The storage space is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: This was over all perfect! I get to Keep all the letters I have to respond to inside of this and then of course my computer sits on top perfectly as well. I can now also eat when I feel like eating in bed without making a mess. I just can't put into words how JUST RIGHT this is for me. Yes it's sturdy plastic but I prefer this over the regular wooden ones. Ordering another one for my daughter cause now she wants one too. Thank you for also packaging it so well and getting it to me so quickly and without damage
customer_reviews.author: Millie Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Meh...  definitely over priced.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat adequate for my 8 year old son but not worth the money. And the legs pop off easily and are very hard to put back on. Cheap plastic, minimal storage space inside, not the best for using a laptop on but can make it work.
customer_reviews.author: wisco73

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this awhile back and thought it best to wait for the review.. Overall great product. legs fold in easily but also not to easily that is collapses. My toddler uses it for various things.. Have a snack in the living room or coloring. the compartment is perfect size for a few coloring books and crayons.. she even sometimes uses it as a stool which is not recommended but thankfully it has not broken or folded in while she is on it. Great product.. would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for one time use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a long car trip and they didn’t even make it to the car before the legs broke off. I gullies and we continued to try to use them b it they’re just plastic junk. I have an avid colorer and thought it would be great to keep her color books and pencils. The kid doesn’t stay shut and the coloring stuff flew all over the van. Don’t waste e money.
customer_reviews.author: Montanamama

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, versatile, exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, light-weight, adequate leg room, lid closes securely, legs fold in easily and lock into place. I use this as a craft surface. I put my current project(s) inside and can then take it from room to room. I am buying another to use on the porch this spring and summer. Sometimes I like to take my meal out there to enjoy. I can put my plate inside the open compartment and no worries about the plate sliding off my lap or the top of the desk surface either. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chaiteagal

customer_reviews.title: not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The legs would not stay fixed. I'm somewhere else and hear a crash,so far I only places few papers and a cell phone on it. Imagine if it was the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hall

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with this table.
customer_reviews.text: I bought tbis for my mother who really loves to color, especially that we are stuck home more. She is able to unfold the legs, and use it as a table. It's easily portable so she can take it anywhere in the house. She even packed it up and took it out of town. She can easliy store it under her bed, and it takes up little room. She stores her books inside of it as well. I will be purchasing one for myself to use for school and my studies.
customer_reviews.author: Brandie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of my work from bed and using pillows to prop my laptop just wasn't cutting it. This folding lap desk was just what I needed. I didn't need anything fancy bells and whistles. Just somethihng to hold my laptop. It has a hidden desk for keeping important notes and pens. A plus! Could be a tad bit sturdy, hence the 4 stars, but nothing to quibble about. Highly recomment.
customer_reviews.author: WickedQueen

customer_reviews.title: Best versatile lap desk
customer_reviews.text: Recently had surgery but could not sit at my desk and needed a solution. I decided to try this product, not only was it cost effective but it is super easy to use, store and the storage allows me to keep my laptop cord and notebook all in one place. To add to the awesomeness it comfortably holds my large laptop so it doesn't feel awkward. Thanks for making such a great product 🖤
customer_reviews.author: Neykko in Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Great for children!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a mother of five kids, taking college courses film time and working, so I thought this would be perfect while sitting on the couch with the kids or toting it along when running to games, etc. It does the job, but I did expect it to be more sturdy and have more leg room than it does. I have given this one to my daughter to use for storage of her coloring books and crayons, as it did not work out the best for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Longacre

customer_reviews.title: It folds up easily for storage which is nice for small homes
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight folding lap desk and functions as expected. It folds up easily for storage which is nice for small homes, apartments, etc. However, I would caution leaving a laptop on it when it is stood up on its legs. You should ensure that the legs are locked when standing it up and away from you (on a desk or table) to prevent it from collapsing especially if you intend to leave a laptop on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of minor issues with this item but the prompt response & willingness to make things right earns 4 stars. I use it every day & it works well for both my 12" & 13" laptop. I did have to add a thin sheet to make it flat just for the small laptop & iPad but no big deal. The response from this company was exemplary.
customer_reviews.author: T. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Best lap table for seniors
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for sitting in my recliner and reading Fire tablet, eating hot SOUP without fear of spills, painting fingernails, all manner of tasks. Easy to fold/unfold and lightweight, but sturdy. Very well made. I like the hidden storage inside! Just right for storing essentials. Excellent purchase, very happy with product and seller!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly in Sunny San Diego🌞

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot less sturdy than I thought it would be. The legs are not solid at all. They are flimsy and with any weight pressed the wrong way will bend them. I do not see this product lasting long. I’m disappointed with the amount of money I spent on it. It seems like something I would have gotten from a discount store.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing. Arrived fast and just as described
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Arrived fast and just as described. My kids (8 and 9 years old ) use these as their homework desks. We keep each stocked with pencils, erasers, pens, highlighters, rulers, scissors, markers, glue sticks, study guudes and more so they can tackle anything thrown at them! They are also light weight and work great when one has after school sports, we just bring the desk with us so my other child can still easily get their homework done in the car or at the game/practice. Very happy with this product!

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase

I use it to do my homework, and it is even enough with my arms to type what I need to type. If you need a lightweight tray, this is the purchase for you. If I ever need another one I will purchase this one again.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had just had surgery and was going to be laid up for awhile. I knew I was buying the cheaper one, so that's why I give it 4/5 stars. It's decent for the money spent. However if I had it to do over again I would have bought a different one. This barely fits over both my legs with my surgical dressing on and isn't comfortable against that incision site. It also folds so easy that I can't move it around on the bed without it collapsing. The storage room is great, the quality is decent. Not a bad purchase for a kid or something.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: It is very nice and portable and she can keep her books & ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my 4 year old daughter to practice writing & coloring. It is very nice and portable and she can keep her books & pencils in it (and not lose them :)). The best feature i like about this is the folding legs. I can shelve it in the cabinet folded and doesnt occupy much space as well. It is a good writing desk for kids. I am not sure if you can assert too much pressure on it (I mean literally lean over it to write or read). Overall it is an excellent purchase for the price and quality, and I am sure we will be using it for a long time.

The storage compartment id very useful to keep my work when not in use.
